metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2851 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Format string vulnerability in the register_disk function in block/genhd.c in the Linux kernel through 3.9.4 allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging root access and writing format string specifiers to /sys/module/md_mod/parameters/new_array in order to create a crafted /dev/md device name. Kees Cook discovered a format string vulnerability in the Linux kernel's disk block layer. A local user with administrator privileges could exploit this flaw to gain kernel privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19

linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19

No subscription required
